item.title: Surging silver and gold slide after CME raises margin requirements
item.description: Silver and gold futures are falling sharply after the Chicago Mercantile Exchange, one of the world’s largest trading floors for commodities, required...

item.title: World shares are mostly lower in quiet holiday trading as China stages war drills near Taiwan
item.description: Shares in Europe and Asia are mostly lower in thin holiday trading as China stages military exercises near the island of Taiwan

item.title: Iranian traders and shopkeepers protest as currency hits record low
item.description: Iranian traders and shopkeepers have staged a second day of protests after the country’s currency plummeted to a new record low against the U.S. dolla...

item.title: South Korea’s climate pledge to cut coal, lower emissions clash with US push for LNG purchases
item.description: South Korea is chasing a coal-free future in efforts to slash carbon emissions, an ambitious goal for the fossil fuel-dependent country

item.title: Protesting students in Serbia urge support for early election they hope will oust Vucic
item.description: Protesting university students in Serbia have collected signatures throughout the country for their request for an early parliamentary election
